story:
Hi everyone, hope you’re all well. I know it’s been tough in the last few months for so many of us so my best wishes and hopes to all of you. I don’t really get involved in SM much but felt this was a poignant time to reach out..... Life has drastically changed for many of us as a result of this crisis - just one example is the impact this has had on our family business (www.thehopeandglory.co.uk) which my wife and the team have worked day and night over the last 3-4 years to turn into a successful brand / business across the UK hospitality sector, which we know has been decimated by this crisis..... And just as we thought there were some green shoots of recovery after the lockdown release - the sector has had the wind blown out of its sails once again with the latest (understandable) lockdown! 

We’ve been very lucky to get through this last 7 months thanks to the support of: 1) our dearest family and friends who’ve given us the confidence that all will be ok; 2) our partners such as our friends in Sri Lanka, amazing suppliers, our investors and supporters and so importantly; 3) our dear partners & customers.

So I decided with the latest lockdown measures in place for what appears to be another 6 months - I wanted our family and team to look ahead with optimism and Hope. After all, whenever tragedy and hardship has hit the human race - we have always battled to recover. Be it conflict, natural disasters, self inflicted troubles - whatever the challenge, somehow, through determination, entrepreneurialism and endeavour - we find a way, not only to survive, but thrive. So, I wanted to set myself a challenge for the next 6 months ahead that allows us to look forward with optimism and countdown the days to a better 2021 for all of us. 

During my efforts to get fitter and stronger again - I came up with a challenge, to follow in the footsteps (literally) of the most amazing Great British Heroes before us who have walked and walked for this great country of ours -  such as Sir Ian Botham and Captain Tom - who have inspired me to come up with a THREE MILLION STEP CHALLENGE (equivalent to approximately 1500 miles) between 1st Oct and 31st March 2021. That’s 250 miles per month or 60-65 miles per week or 20-25,000 steps a day! 

This period ahead will be tough for many of us but more difficult for some than others in our community and so I wanted to do a little something to raise a spotlight for these causes that are close to my heart that help and support those less fortunate than us, especially during this time - 1) Cancer Research UK; 2) CRISIS; 3) Make A Wish Foundation; 4) Age Concern; 5) Alzheimer’s Society; 6) WWF

The target is to raise £6000 in total by 31st March 2021 for all these causes (£1000 each) with your help and support - here is my Just Giving page - if you’re able to support and spread the word - that would be amazing. Every penny will help and make such a difference!

story:
After five years of conflict, most of the population in Yemen needs humanitarian assistance. They have a lack of basic healthcare, severe food shortages and limited clean water. 

It caught my attention on BBC news, when it was finally covered how devastating some peoples lives are in Yemen. Yemen is suffering from one of the world's worst humanitarian crisis. It hurts to think we have stores and stores full of food in the UK and so much wastage, where a mere fraction would be so useful to supporting the other side of the world. It is so sad to think that 85,000 children under 5 have died from starvation!

We know how devastating Covid-19 has been on our day to day lives and just think, how Yemen would have felt, when they already had the pressure of war and famine to deal with. 

I have made this page in hope of raising funds to contribute towards Yemen's famine crisis. If any of you have little nephews, nieces, sons and daughters, please empathise with the many mothers who are scared of losing their children. Please donate what you can - whether it be £3, £5 or £10 and so on towards a cause you know are serving the helpless. I would appreciate it! 

I will be donating £40 to CARE and in addition will be meeting targets of my own. I have recently got back into running after a chronic injury and want to get better timings running around my local park and will be reporting these times. I also have always been interested and protective of society's minorities that are disadvantaged - whether that be mental health, physical disability and people with impairments. The minority I want to focus on, are deaf people and how sign language is not commonly known. I do feel deaf people are outcasted by society, where little effort is made to accommodate them . So I will be learning 20 sign language phrases, in addition to the alphabet, and will be posting these learnings on social media. 

Here's a little more about CARE...

 CARE is focused on helping the most vulnerable people, through distributing food to families in need, and cash vouchers so that families can purchase for themselves the food they need. Over a year of fighting and fuel shortages has destroyed water pipes and water pumping facilities, so CARE is rehabilitating water sources and providing water tanks so women and children can get safe drinking water without having to travel long distances. CARE is also providing hygiene kits, paying special attention to womens and children's needs.Thank you for reading. For more information please visit the dedicated Yemen Crisis page on CARE's website: www.careinternational.org.uk/emergencies/yemen-crisis
